There are couple of methods mentioned in the JUnit
FAQ:

"If you are using additional jars from 3rd party
vendors you can either: 
update this file (excluded.properties) in the
junit.jar and add your package paths or, 
'patch' the junit.util.excluded.properties file with
the CLASSPATH, that is, put your customized version of
this file in the class path before the junit.jar. In
this way your version will be loaded instead of the
one that comes with junit. "

I have used the former method to add my own and other
packages with no problems.

HTH

Steve

--- Mike Morris <mike.morris@...>
wrote:

> Does anyone else feel that it would be useful to be
